text: Task 16: Admin Dashboard and Analytics Admin Dashboard: Admins Can Access Admin Dashboard Gives Admin: A full overview of the system Tools to manage users and the content insights through analytics 1) System - Wide Analytics ( Numbers and Graphs ) Admin Should be able to see: Total Users Total Books Uploaded Total Summaries Generated Usage Over Time ( daily/monthly) Instead of Raw Numbers ,We show Graphs Graphs Help Admin: Understand of growth detect problems make decisions We Use Libraries Like: Matplotlib Plotly 2)User Management Features Admins Should be able to: View all users Deactivate a user account reset user passwords Admin Need Full Controll 3)Content Moderation Tools Sometimes Users May: Upload Inappropiate Content Upload Copyrighted Books so admins should be able to : Review flagged content Delete inappropiate uploads 4)System Health Monitoring Admins Must Also Know is the system healthy? we show: Database Size Model Processing Time Error Logs Failed Requests This Helps Admins : Fix Issues Early Improve Perfomance Aviod Crashes 5)Backup and Export Features What if: Database Crashes Server Fails Admins Should be Able to : create database backups Export data as files Implementation Task 16 : step1 ) Admin Authentication & Authorization Ensure only Admins Can Access Admin Routes def admin_required(user): if user.role !="admin": raise HTTPException(status_code=403) Step 2: Admin Dashboard Api's @app.get("/admin/stats") def get_stats(): return{ "users":db.query(User).count(), "books": db.query(Book).count(), "Summaries } step3 : Usage Over Time Data @app.get("/Admin/usage") def usage_stats(): step4: Graphs Using Matplotlib import matplotlib.pyplot as plt def generate_graph(dates, Counts): plt.plot(dates , counts) plt.xlabel("Date") ply.ylabel("summaries generated") plt.title("Usage Over Time) plt.show() step5: User Management Api's view users @app.get("/admin/users") -------------------- Deactivate User @app.post("/admin/users/{id}/deactivate") def deactivate_user(id:int): step6: Content Moderation @app.get step7: System Health Monitoring @app.get("/admin/system-health") step8:Backup & Export step9:Admin Dashboard UI Dashboard Section Have: Stats Cards Graphs User Table Content Review Panel System Health Page
